ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Gaming Death
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve been told by the phone company that they are not required to give me an internet line and that they are only legally obligated to give me about 9k of
ygData.messageBody:
> There are federal regulations about the min standards (aka bandwidth) that
> must be made available to you. Since you had bandwidth X, and they took
> some of it away to put in 2nd line to somebody else, you can raise holy
> hell with your state's PUC, and the FCC.
>
I've been told by the phone company that they are not required to give me an
internet line and that they are only legally obligated to give me about 9k
of bandwidth. Nevermind that I can't use more than one phone at a time and
still get a connection. The lower the bandwidth the less phones you can use.
I was told that with my bandwidth I can't have more than 4 phones working--
but I don't even have 4 phones working. 2 ring but only one can work if
picked up.
>
> Look up the local rules & regulations, then cite them in letters to your
> telco. When they don't do anything, send them to your PUC, and CC the
> telco. Generally the PUCs and FCC has great fun coming down like a hammer
> on companies that do things like this.
>
Any idea on where I can find the rules and regulations for my area?
luv,
-Su

>
> On Wed, 17 Jul 2002, Su wrote:
>
> > Heh. I live in the boonies. They won't even put cable TV out where I
live.
> > Nor will they make the lines DSL ready. Y'know how cable shares a line
for
> > internet? My phone company was too cheap to put full phone lines out to
my
> > area. So they just take a single phone line that is supposed to service
one
> > house, and splice it up to service all of the houses in my area. I was
> > connecting at 26k until my neighbor got another phoneline installed so
now I
> > only get 21.6k. They actually took some of my line away to give him a
line--
> > they did it wrong at first so one of my lines wasn't usable and it kept
> > saying it was ringing for 3 days in a row (which is how long it took
them to
> > come out and fix it). Ruined 2 of my phones.
> > But that's life.
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> >
> > > get DLS or a cable modem.
> > >
> > > or do you live in the BOONIES
> > >
> > >
> > > --- Su <suceress@...> wrote:
> > > > I wish I could. But my phone company has a monopoly
> > > > in the area and won't do
> > > > anything about it. I can't even get them to do
> > > > maintenance that they are
> > > > supposed to be required to do. I'm going to have to
> > > > call someone above their
> > > > heads to get something done.
> > > > luv,
> > > > -Su
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > > Gotta hope you get that connection problem licked.
> > > > Especially with
> > > > > such a nice rig as you have described.
> > > > >
> > > > > Barto Proudfoot
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
> > > > > > I absolutely hate game death and try to avoid it
> > > > whenever possible.
> > > > > I let
> > > > > > people know right off that if I think I am going
> > > > to get killed I
> > > > > will flee.
> > > > > > A dead cleric isn't very helpful. Especially
> > > > since I only have a
> > > > > 21.6k
> > > > > > connection and we're talking about waiting 5 or
> > > > more minutes to
> > > > > reload from
> > > > > > death. When my mother is playing also, my zoning
> > > > like that can
> > > > > cause her to
> > > > > > lag very badly. If she has to zone or gets
> > > > killed then one or both
> > > > > of us get
> > > > > > booted offline. And I lose alot of xp. So that
> > > > isn't fun.
> > > > > > luv,
> > > > > > -Su
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > > My locution in the previous message expressed
> > > > my feelings toward
> > > > > game
> > > > > > > death, and raised my curiosity. What are other
> > > > player's attitudes
> > > > > > > toward game death?
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > I play solo most of the time, and haven't had
> > > > a guild to depend on
> > > > > > > since Wave of Change faded away. So, death,
> > > > especially death in
> > > > > > > awkward circumstances, is more serious to my
> > > > character. I can't
> > > > > just
> > > > > > > call on my guild reserector to pull my butt
> > > > out of the grave, nor
> > > > > do
> > > > > > > have high level guildies to drag my corpse out
> > > > from under some big
> > > > > > > nasty.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > My son-in-law plays with abandon. He leaves
> > > > corpses all over the
> > > > > > > place, joins groups readily, and seems to have
> > > > great fun doing all
> > > > > > > that.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > My son, on the other hand, is in a powerful
> > > > guild on our server.
> > > > > He
> > > > > > > is less cautious than me, but still uses sound
> > > > strategy and
> > > > > tactics
> > > > > > > and utilized his guild to advance on his
> > > > goals. His guild is the
> > > > > > > Guardian Alliance on Zeb.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > I figure I will have to do the guild and group
> > > > thing soon, but
> > > > > enjoy
> > > > > > > my independence enough that I want to do so as
> > > > late in my career
> > > > > as
> > > > > > > possible.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Barto Proudfoot
> > > > > > >
